Uses of Class
org.smtlib.IParser.ParserException

  • Packages that use IParser.ParserException 
    Package Description
    org.smtlib
    This package contains the main classes and abstract interfaces for this SMT-LIB tool; the tool provides a stand-alone SMT-LIB-compliant command-line application, an application that responds to SMT-LIB commands over a network port, and an SMT-LIB Java API.
    org.smtlib.command
    This package contains implementations of the SMT-LIB commands, implementing the interfaces defined in ICommand; these implementations are independent of the concrete syntax that might be used, except that each command object has methods that can parse or print representations of the command in the standard (or potentially other) concrete syntaxes.
    org.smtlib.ext
    This package contains commands that are extensions to SMT-LIB.
    org.smtlib.sexpr
    This package is a concrete implementation of a particular concrete syntax for the abstract SMT-LIB semantics.

    • Uses of IParser.ParserException in org.smtlib

      Subclasses of IParser.ParserException in org.smtlib 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  IParser.AbortParseException
      An exception to be thrown if parsing is to be intentionally aborted (and restarted, ignoring any tokens since the last successful call to the parser.
      static class  IParser.SyntaxException
      An exception to be thrown if there is an unrecoverable problem scanning the syntax
      Methods in org.smtlib that throw IParser.ParserException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean IParser.isEOD()
      Returns true if the parser is at the end of data
      IExpr.IAttribute<?> IParser.parseAttribute()
      Parse an attribute (keyword with optional value), returning null with error messages if an error occurs.
      IExpr.IAttributeValue IParser.parseAttributeValue()
      Parses a value for an attribute, returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      IExpr.IBinaryLiteral IParser.parseBinary()
      Parse an SMT-LIB binary literal; return null and log an error response if there is no numeral
      IExpr.IBinding IParser.parseBinding()
      Parses a binding "(id expression)", returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      java.util.List<IExpr.IBinding> IParser.parseBindings()
      Parses a parenthesized sequence of let-bindings, returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      ICommand IParser.parseCommand()
      Parses an SMT-LIB command, if the parser is looking at text representing a valid SMT-LIB command; returns null and logs errors if the text is not a valid command.
      IExpr.IDecimal IParser.parseDecimal()
      Parse an SMT-LIB decimal literal; return null and log an error response if there is no numeral
      IExpr.IDeclaration IParser.parseDeclaration()
      Parses a declaration "(id sort)", returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      java.util.List<IExpr.IDeclaration> IParser.parseDeclarations()
      Parses a parenthesized sequence of IDeclaration items, returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      IExpr IParser.parseExpr()
      Parses a term or formula; return null and log an error response if there is no term or formula
      IExpr.IHexLiteral IParser.parseHex()
      Parse an SMT-LIB hex literal; return null and log an error response if there is no numeral
      IExpr.IIdentifier IParser.parseIdentifier()
      Parses an identifier (either a symbol or a parameterized identifier) from the token stream, returning null (with logged error messages) if there is not one.
      IExpr.IKeyword IParser.parseKeyword()
      Parse an SMT-LIB keyword; return null and log an error response if there is no valid keyword
      IExpr.ILiteral IParser.parseLiteral()
      Parse an SMT-LIB literal of any kind; return null and log an error response if there is no literal
      ILogic IParser.parseLogic()
      Parse an SMT-LIB logic; return null and log an error response if there is no valid logic definition
      IExpr.INumeral IParser.parseNumeral()
      Parse an SMT-LIB numeral; return null and log an error response if there is no numeral
      IExpr.IQualifiedIdentifier IParser.parseQualifiedIdentifier()
      Parses a qualified identifier (either a symbol, a parameterized identifier, or an as identifier) from the token stream, returning null (with logged error messages) if there is not one.
      ICommand.IScript IParser.parseScript()
      Parses an SMT-LIB command script.
      ISort IParser.parseSort(java.util.List<ISort.IParameter> parameters)
      Parses a sort, returning null with error messages if a valid sort is not in the next parser tokens.
      IExpr.IStringLiteral IParser.parseStringLiteral()
      Parse an SMT-LIB string literal; return null and log an error response if there is no valid string literal
      IExpr.ISymbol IParser.parseSymbol()
      Parse an SMT-LIB symbol; return null and log an error response if there is no symbol
      ITheory IParser.parseTheory()
      Parse an SMT-LIB theory; return null and log an error response if there is no valid theory definition

    • Uses of IParser.ParserException in org.smtlib.sexpr

      Methods in org.smtlib.sexpr that throw IParser.ParserException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ILexToken Lexer.getToken()
      Returns the next lexical token, advancing the scanner.
      ILexToken Lexer.getToken(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
      Returns the next lexical token; if the token returned matches the given class (or is a subclass), then the scanner is advanced; if the token does not match, the scanner is not advanced.
      protected ILexToken Lexer.getToken(java.util.regex.Matcher matcher)
      Returns the next token found in the given matcher, advancing the matcher
      ILexToken Lexer.getToken(java.lang.String text)
      Returns the first token found in the given text
      boolean Lexer.isEOD()
      Returns true if the next token is the end-of-data
      boolean Lexer.isLP()
      Returns true if the next token is a left parenthesis (without consuming it)
      boolean Lexer.isRP()
      Returns true if the next token is a right parenthesis (without consuming it)
      private IExpr.IAsIdentifier Parser.parseAsIdentifierRest(ILexToken lp)
      Parses an 'as' identifier, presuming the left-paren and the 'as' are already parsed, from the token stream, returning null (with logged error messages) if there is not one.
      IExpr.IAttribute<?> Parser.parseAttribute()
      Parse an attribute (keyword with optional value), returning null with error messages if an error occurs.
      java.util.List<IExpr.IAttribute<?>> Parser.parseAttributeSequence()
      Parse a sequence of attributes (keyword with optional value) terminated by a right parenthesis, returning null with error messages if an error occurs.
      IExpr.IAttributeValue Parser.parseAttributeValue()
      Parse an attribute (keyword with optional value), returning null with error messages if an error occurs.
      IExpr.IBinaryLiteral Parser.parseBinary()
      Parses a binary literal, returning null with the given message if an error occurs; if the next token is not a binary literal, the token is not consumed,
      IExpr.IBinding Parser.parseBinding()
      Parses a binding "(id expression)", returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      java.util.List<IExpr.IBinding> Parser.parseBindings()
      Parses a parenthesized sequence of let-bindings, returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      IExpr.IDecimal Parser.parseDecimal()
      Parses a decimal, returning null with the given message if an error occurs; if the next token is not a decimal, the token is not consumed,
      IExpr.IDeclaration Parser.parseDeclaration()
      Parses a declaration "(id sort)", returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      java.util.List<IExpr.IDeclaration> Parser.parseDeclarations()
      Parses a parenthesized sequence of IDeclaration items, returning null with error messages if an error occurs
      IExpr Parser.parseExpr()
      Parses an expression, returning null with error messages if there is not a valid expression in the token stream.
      IExpr.IHexLiteral Parser.parseHex()
      Parses a hex literal, returning null with the given message if an error occurs; if the next token is not a hex literal, the token is not consumed,
      IExpr.IIdentifier Parser.parseIdentifier()
      Parses an identifier (either symbol or parameterized identifier) from the token stream, returning null with logged error messages if there is not one.
      private IExpr.IIdentifier Parser.parseIdentifierRest(ILexToken lp)
      Parses a parameterized identifier from the token stream, presuming the left parenthesis and the underscore character are already read, return null with logged error messages if there is not one.
      SMTExpr.Keyword Parser.parseKeyword()
      Parses a keyword, returning null with an error message if an error occurs; if the next token is not a keyword, the token is not consumed.
      SMTExpr.Keyword Parser.parseKeyword(java.lang.String msg)
      Parses a keyword, returning null with messages if an error occurs.
      IExpr.ILiteral Parser.parseLiteral()
      Parses a literal, returning null with error messages if an error occurs.
      ILogic Parser.parseLogic()
      Parses a logic definition (including beginning and ending parentheses, returning null with error messages if it fails; only part of the checking of the contents is performed in this call (the rest is done in loadLogic).
      ILexToken Parser.parseLP()
      Parses a left parenthesis, returning null and emitting an error message if there isn't one (and the next token is not consumed)
      IExpr.INumeral Parser.parseNumeral()
      Parses a numeral, returning null with error messages if an error occurs; if the next token is not a numeral, the token is not consumed,
      SMTExpr.Numeral Parser.parseNumeral(java.lang.String msg)
      Parses a numeral, returning null with the given message if an error occurs; if the next token is not a numeral, the token is not consumed,
      IExpr.IQualifiedIdentifier Parser.parseQualifiedIdentifier()
      Parses a qualified identifier (either a symbol, a parameterized identifier, or an as identifier) from the token stream, returning null (with logged error messages) if there is not one.
      IResponse Parser.parseResponse(java.lang.String response) 
      ILexToken Parser.parseRP()
      Parses a right parenthesis, returning null and emitting an error message if there isn't one (and the next token is not consumed)
      ILexToken Parser.parseRP(java.lang.String msg)
      Parses a right parenthesis, returning null and emitting an error message if there isn't one (and the next token is not consumed); the error message is the argument, with any '# character replaced by the kind() of the actual next token.
      Sexpr.Seq Parser.parseSeq(ILexToken lp)
      Parses and adds Sexpr to a list until parseSexpr returns null (indicating a RightParen has been seen or end of input or an error)
      Sexpr Parser.parseSexpr()
      Parses an Sexpr
      Sort Parser.parseSort(java.util.List<ISort.IParameter> parameters)
      Parses a sort, returning null with error messages if a valid sort is not in the next parser tokens.
      java.util.List<ISort> Parser.parseSortList(java.util.List<ISort.IParameter> parameters)
      Parses sequence of sorts up to a right-parenthesis, returning null with error messages if an error occurs.
      SMTExpr.StringLiteral Parser.parseStringLiteral()
      Parses a string literal, returning null with an error message if an error occurs; if the next token is not a string literal, the token is not consumed,
      SMTExpr.Symbol Parser.parseSymbol()
      Parses a symbol, returning null with messages and not advancing the parser if an error occurs
      SMTExpr.Symbol Parser.parseSymbol(java.lang.String msg)
      Parses a symbol (but not a reserved word unless the configuration field 'relax' is true), returning null with messages if an error occurs; the parser is advanced only if an actual symbol is parsed.
      SMTExpr.Symbol Parser.parseSymbolOrReservedWord(java.lang.String msg)
      Parses a symbol or a reserved word, returning null with messages if an error occurs.
      ITheory Parser.parseTheory()
      Parses a theory definition (including beginning and ending parentheses, returning null with error messages if it fails; only part of the checking of the contents is performed in this call (the rest is done in loadTheory).
      ILexToken Lexer.peekToken()
      Returns the next lexical token without consuming it; a subsequent call to getToken will return the same token.
      IPos Lexer.skipThruRP()
      Reads and discards tokens until an unmatched right parenthesis or end-of-data is read
